intro: Balsamea zanzibarica, commonly known as Zanzibar balsam, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant. Balsamea zanzibarica is also noted for its ability to produce a sticky resin, which has been used traditionally in some regions.
